page.title: 10A DAIRY FARM.(HIGHER BARN)
page.content:
Now there is only one{dairy farm }in the area. This farm is of 120 acres. The herd is of 119{Friesian cows}and {Limousin bull.}The calves are sold. The cows are milked every day at 0600 hrs and again at 1830hrs and each give 40 pints, on average, a day.They give milk for about 300 days a year. Heifers cost Â£450. After 4 years of giving milk they are sold for Â£350 to be slaughtered. 110 acres of grass is grown for grazing and silage. Maize and fodder beet are also grown for winter feed. The cows also eat sugar pulp in the winter.
{
